page.title: 06THE VIEW FROM CHURCH GREEN
page.content:
If you were to stand on the top of Church Green you would see the River Medway and the ships coming into and out of the docks or at anchor. You would also see a lot of timber because it is one of Medways main imports. A view of the two bridges, the train and the vehicle bridge is also possible. Taller ships can not pass under these bridges. There are many private pleasure crafts on the River Medway. Alongside the river you can see cranes that pick-up the cargo from ships. In the Medway you can see orange and yellow buoys that mark the depth of the channels so that the bigger ships would not run aground.
By David Allen English Martyrs
